CloudWatchLogsLogGroupArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CloudWatch Logs group to publish logs to.

LogPublishingOption.documentation:
Specifies whether the Amazon OpenSearch Service domain publishes the OpenSearch application and slow logs to Amazon CloudWatch. For more information, see Monitoring OpenSearch logs with Amazon CloudWatch Logs.

After you enable log publishing, you still have to enable the collection of slow logs using the OpenSearch REST API.

Options.documentation: The log publishing options configured for the domain.

Status.documentation: The status of the log publishing options for the domain.

LogPublishingOptionsStatus.documentation: The configured log publishing options for the domain and their current status.

LogType.documentation:
The type of log file. Can be one of the following:

  • INDEX_SLOW_LOGS - Index slow logs contain insert requests that took more time than the configured index query log threshold to execute.

  • SEARCH_SLOW_LOGS - Search slow logs contain search queries that took more time than the configured search query log threshold to execute.

  • ES_APPLICATION_LOGS - OpenSearch application logs contain information about errors and warnings raised during the operation of the service and can be useful for troubleshooting.

  • AUDIT_LOGS - Audit logs contain records of user requests for access to the domain.

MasterUserARN.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the master user. Only specify if InternalUserDatabaseEnabled is false.

MasterUserName.documentation: User name for the master user. Only specify if InternalUserDatabaseEnabled is true.

MasterUserPassword.documentation: Password for the master user. Only specify if InternalUserDatabaseEnabled is true.

MasterUserOptions.documentation: Credentials for the master user for a domain.

MaxResults.documentation: An optional parameter that specifies the maximum number of results to return for a given request.

MaximumInstanceCount.documentation: Maximum number of instances that can be instantiated for a given instance type.

MinimumInstanceCount.documentation: Minimum number of instances that can be instantiated for a given instance type.

Name.documentation: The name of the property that is currently being modified.

ActiveValue.documentation: The current value of the domain property that is being modified.

PendingValue.documentation: The value that the property that is currently being modified will eventually have.

ValueType.documentation:
The type of value that is currently being modified. Properties can have two types:

  • PLAIN_TEXT: Contain direct values such as "1", "True", or "c5.large.search".

  • STRINGIFIED_JSON: Contain content in JSON format, such as {"Enabled":"True"}".

ModifyingProperties.documentation: Information about the domain properties that are currently being modified.

DesiredState.documentation: The desired state of the natural language query generation feature. Valid values are ENABLED and DISABLED.

NaturalLanguageQueryGenerationOptionsInp.documentation: Container for parameters required to enable the natural language query generation feature.

DesiredState.documentation: The desired state of the natural language query generation feature. Valid values are ENABLED and DISABLED.

CurrentState.documentation: The current state of the natural language query generation feature, indicating completion, in progress, or failure.

NaturalLanguageQueryGenerationOptionsOut.documentation: Container for parameters representing the state of the natural language query generation feature on the specified domain.

NextToken.documentation: When nextToken is returned, there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. Send the request again using the returned token to retrieve the next page.

Enabled.documentation: A boolean value indicating whether a specific node type is active or inactive.

Type.documentation: The instance type of a particular node within the cluster.

Count.documentation: The number of nodes of a specific type within the cluster.

NodeConfig.documentation: Configuration options for defining the setup of any node type within the cluster.

NodeType.documentation: Defines the type of node, such as coordinating nodes.

NodeConfig.documentation: Configuration options for defining the setup of any node type.

NodeOption.documentation: Configuration settings for defining the node type within a cluster.

NodeToNodeEncryptionOptions.documentation: Enables or disables node-to-node encryption. For more information, see Node-to-node encryption for Amazon OpenSearch Service.

Options.documentation: The node-to-node encryption options for the specified domain.

Status.documentation: The status of the node-to-node encryption options for the specified domain.

NodeToNodeEncryptionOptionsStatus.documentation: Status of the node-to-node encryption options for the specified domain.

WindowStartTime.documentation: A custom start time for the off-peak window, in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The window length will always be 10 hours, so you can't specify an end time. For example, if you specify 11:00 P.M. UTC as a start time, the end time will automatically be set to 9:00 A.M.

OffPeakWindow.documentation:
A custom 10-hour, low-traffic window during which OpenSearch Service can perform mandatory configuration changes on the domain. These actions can include scheduled service software updates and blue/green Auto-Tune enhancements. OpenSearch Service will schedule these actions during the window that you specify.

If you don't specify a window start time, it defaults to 10:00 P.M. local time.

For more information, see Defining off-peak maintenance windows for Amazon OpenSearch Service.

Enabled.documentation:
Whether to enable an off-peak window.

This option is only available when modifying a domain created prior to February 16, 2023, not when creating a new domain. All domains created after this date have the off-peak window enabled by default. You can't disable the off-peak window after it's enabled for a domain.

OffPeakWindowOptions.documentation: Options for a domain's off-peak window, during which OpenSearch Service can perform mandatory configuration changes on the domain.

Status.documentation: The current status of off-peak window options.

OffPeakWindowOptionsStatus.documentation: The status of off-peak window options for a domain.

OptionState.documentation:
The state of a requested domain configuration change. Can be one of the following:

  • Processing - The requested change is still in progress.

  • Active - The requested change is processed and deployed to the domain.

CreationDate.documentation: The timestamp when the entity was created.

UpdateDate.documentation: The timestamp of the last time the entity was updated.

PendingDeletion.documentation: Indicates whether the entity is being deleted.

OptionStatus.documentation: Provides the current status of an entity.

OutboundConnection.documentation: Specifies details about an outbound cross-cluster connection.

StatusCode.documentation:
The status code for the outbound connection. Can be one of the following:

  • VALIDATING - The outbound connection request is being validated.

  • VALIDATION_FAILED - Validation failed for the connection request.

  • PENDING_ACCEPTANCE: Outbound connection request is validated and is not yet accepted by the remote domain owner.

  • APPROVED - Outbound connection has been approved by the remote domain owner for getting provisioned.

  • PROVISIONING - Outbound connection request is in process.

  • ACTIVE - Outbound connection is active and ready to use.

  • REJECTING - Outbound connection rejection by remote domain owner is in progress.

  • REJECTED - Outbound connection request is rejected by remote domain owner.

  • DELETING - Outbound connection deletion is in progress.

  • DELETED - Outbound connection is deleted and can no longer be used.

OutboundConnectionStatus.documentation: The status of an outbound cross-cluster connection.

OverallChangeStatus.documentation: The overall status value of the domain configuration change.

KeyStoreAccessOption.documentation: The configuration parameters to enable accessing the key store required by the package.

PackageAssociationConfiguration.documentation: The configuration for associating a package with a domain.

LicenseFilepath.documentation: The relative file path for the license associated with the package.

RequiresRestartForConfigurationUpdate.documentation: This indicates whether a B/G deployment is required for updating the configuration that the plugin is prerequisite for.

PackageConfiguration.documentation: The configuration parameters for a package.

PackageStatus.documentation: The current status of the package. The available options are AVAILABLE, COPYING, COPY_FAILED, VALIDATNG, VALIDATION_FAILED, DELETING, and DELETE_FAILED.

CreatedAt.documentation: The timestamp when the package was created.

LastUpdatedAt.documentation: Date and time when the package was last updated.

ErrorDetails.documentation: Additional information if the package is in an error state. Null otherwise.

EngineVersion.documentation: Version of OpenSearch or Elasticsearch, in the format Elasticsearch_X.Y or OpenSearch_X.Y. Defaults to the latest version of OpenSearch.

AvailablePluginProperties.documentation: If the package is a ZIP-PLUGIN package, additional information about plugin properties.

AvailablePackageConfiguration.documentation: This represents the available configuration parameters for the package.

AllowListedUserList.documentation: A list of users who are allowed to view and associate the package. This field is only visible to the owner of a package.

PackageOwner.documentation: The owner of the package who is allowed to create and update a package and add users to the package scope.

PackageID.documentation: Internal ID of the package that you want to associate with a domain.

PrerequisitePackageIDList.documentation: List of package IDs that must be linked to the domain before or simultaneously with the package association.

AssociationConfiguration.documentation: The configuration parameters for associating the package with a domain.

PackageDetailsForAssociation.documentation: Details of a package that is associated with a domain.

KmsKeyIdentifier.documentation: KMS key ID for encrypting the package.

EncryptionEnabled.documentation: Whether encryption is enabled for the package.

S3BucketName.documentation: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket containing the package.

PackageSource.documentation: The Amazon S3 location to import the package from.

VendingEnabled.documentation: Indicates whether the package vending feature is enabled, allowing the package to be used by other users.

PackageVendingOptions.documentation: Configuration options for determining whether a package can be made available for use by other users.

CommitMessage.documentation: A message associated with the package version when it was uploaded.

CreatedAt.documentation: The date and time when the package was created.

PluginProperties.documentation: Additional information about plugin properties if the package is a ZIP-PLUGIN package.

PackageConfiguration.documentation: The configuration details for a specific version of a package.

ClassName.documentation: The name of the class to load.

PolicyDocument.documentation: Access policy rules for an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain endpoint. For more information, see Configuring access policies. The maximum size of a policy document is 100 KB.

ReservedInstanceOfferingId.documentation: The ID of the Reserved Instance offering to purchase.

ReservationName.documentation: A customer-specified identifier to track this reservation.

InstanceCount.documentation: The number of OpenSearch instances to reserve.

PurchaseReservedInstanceOfferingRequest.documentation: Container for request parameters to the PurchaseReservedInstanceOffering operation.

ReservedInstanceId.documentation: The ID of the Reserved Instance offering that was purchased.

ReservationName.documentation: The customer-specified identifier used to track this reservation.

RecurringChargeAmount.documentation: The monetary amount of the recurring charge.

RecurringCharge.documentation: Contains the specific price and frequency of a recurring charges for an OpenSearch Reserved Instance, or for a Reserved Instance offering.

ConnectionId.documentation: The unique identifier of the inbound connection to reject.

RejectInboundConnectionRequest.documentation: Container for the request parameters to the RejectInboundConnection operation.

Connection.documentation: Contains details about the rejected inbound connection.

ARN.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the domain, data source, or application from which you want to delete the specified tags.

TagKeys.documentation: The list of tag keys to remove from the domain, data source, or application.

RemoveTagsRequest.documentation: Container for the request parameters to the RemoveTags operation.

ReservationName.documentation: The customer-specified identifier to track this reservation.

BillingSubscriptionId.documentation: The unique identifier of the billing subscription.

ReservedInstanceOfferingId.documentation: The unique identifier of the Reserved Instance offering.

InstanceType.documentation: The OpenSearch instance type offered by theReserved Instance offering.

StartTime.documentation: The date and time when the reservation was purchased.

Duration.documentation: The duration, in seconds, for which the OpenSearch instance is reserved.

FixedPrice.documentation: The upfront fixed charge you will paid to purchase the specific Reserved Instance offering.

UsagePrice.documentation: The hourly rate at which you're charged for the domain using this Reserved Instance.

InstanceCount.documentation: The number of OpenSearch instances that have been reserved.

PaymentOption.documentation: The payment option as defined in the Reserved Instance offering.

RecurringCharges.documentation: The recurring charge to your account, regardless of whether you create any domains using the Reserved Instance offering.

ReservedInstanceOfferingId.documentation: The unique identifier of the Reserved Instance offering.

InstanceType.documentation: The OpenSearch instance type offered by the Reserved Instance offering.

Duration.documentation: The duration, in seconds, for which the offering will reserve the OpenSearch instance.

FixedPrice.documentation: The upfront fixed charge you will pay to purchase the specific Reserved Instance offering.

UsagePrice.documentation: The hourly rate at which you're charged for the domain using this Reserved Instance.

CurrencyCode.documentation: The currency code for the Reserved Instance offering.

PaymentOption.documentation: Payment option for the Reserved Instance offering

RecurringCharges.documentation: The recurring charge to your account, regardless of whether you creates any domains using the offering.

ReservedInstanceOffering.documentation: Details of an OpenSearch Reserved Instance offering.

ResourceAlreadyExistsException.documentation: An exception for creating a resource that already exists.

ResourceNotFoundException.documentation: An exception for accessing or deleting a resource that doesn't exist.

DomainName.documentation: The name of the OpenSearch Service domain.

Account.documentation: The account ID to revoke access from.

Service.documentation: The service SP to revoke access from.

RollbackOnDisable.documentation: The rollback state while disabling Auto-Tune for the domain.

RoleArn.documentation: >The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the S3 Glue Data Catalog.

S3GlueDataCatalog.documentation: Information about the Amazon S3 Glue Data Catalog.

S3VectorsEngine.documentation: Options for enabling S3 vectors engine features on the specified domain.

MetadataContent.documentation: The metadata of the SAML application, in XML format.

EntityId.documentation: The unique entity ID of the application in the SAML identity provider.

Enabled.documentation: True to enable SAML authentication for a domain.

MasterUserName.documentation: The SAML master user name, which is stored in the domain's internal user database.

MasterBackendRole.documentation: The backend role that the SAML master user is mapped to.

SubjectKey.documentation: Element of the SAML assertion to use for the user name. Default is NameID.

RolesKey.documentation: Element of the SAML assertion to use for backend roles. Default is roles.

SessionTimeoutMinutes.documentation: The duration, in minutes, after which a user session becomes inactive. Acceptable values are between 1 and 1440, and the default value is 60.

SAMLOptionsInput.documentation: The SAML authentication configuration for an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain.

SubjectKey.documentation: The key used for matching the SAML subject attribute.

RolesKey.documentation: The key used for matching the SAML roles attribute.

SessionTimeoutMinutes.documentation: The duration, in minutes, after which a user session becomes inactive.

SAMLOptionsOutput.documentation: Describes the SAML application configured for the domain.

Id.documentation: The unique identifier of the scheduled action.

Type.documentation: The type of action that will be taken on the domain.

ScheduledTime.documentation: The time when the change is scheduled to happen.

Description.documentation: A description of the action to be taken.

ScheduledBy.documentation: Whether the action was scheduled manually (CUSTOMER, or by OpenSearch Service automatically (SYSTEM).

Status.documentation: The current status of the scheduled action.

Mandatory.documentation: Whether the action is required or optional.

Cancellable.documentation: Whether or not the scheduled action is cancellable.

ScheduledAction.documentation: Information about a scheduled configuration change for an OpenSearch Service domain. This actions can be a service software update or a blue/green Auto-Tune enhancement.

ScheduledAutoTuneDescription.documentation: The description of an Auto-Tune maintenance action that occurs on a domain.

Date.documentation: The date and time when the Auto-Tune action is scheduled for the domain.

Severity.documentation: The severity of the Auto-Tune action. Valid values are LOW, MEDIUM, and HIGH.

ScheduledAutoTuneDetails.documentation: Specifies details about a scheduled Auto-Tune action. For more information, see Auto-Tune for Amazon OpenSearch Service.

RoleArn.documentation: The unique identifier of the IAM role that grants OpenSearch Service permission to access the specified data source.

SecurityLakeDirectQueryDataSource.documentation: Configuration details for a Security Lake data source that can be used for direct queries.

CurrentVersion.documentation: The current service software version present on the domain.

NewVersion.documentation: The new service software version, if one is available.

UpdateAvailable.documentation: True if you're able to update your service software version. False if you can't update your service software version.

Cancellable.documentation: True if you're able to cancel your service software version update. False if you can't cancel your service software update.

UpdateStatus.documentation: The status of your service software update.

Description.documentation: A description of the service software update status.

AutomatedUpdateDate.documentation: The timestamp, in Epoch time, until which you can manually request a service software update. After this date, we automatically update your service software.

OptionalDeployment.documentation: True if a service software is never automatically updated. False if a service software is automatically updated after the automated update date.

ServiceSoftwareOptions.documentation: The current status of the service software for an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain. For more information, see Service software updates in Amazon OpenSearch Service.

ServiceUrl.documentation: The domain endpoint to which index and search requests are submitted. For example, search-imdb-movies-oopcnjfn6ugo.eu-west-1.es.amazonaws.com or doc-imdb-movies-oopcnjfn6u.eu-west-1.es.amazonaws.com.

SkipUnavailableStatus.documentation:
The status of SkipUnavailable setting for the outbound connection.

  • ENABLED - The SkipUnavailable setting is enabled for the connection.

  • DISABLED - The SkipUnavailable setting is disabled for the connection.

SlotSuggestions.documentation: Alternate time slots during which OpenSearch Service has available capacity to schedule a domain action.

SlotNotAvailableException.documentation: An exception for attempting to schedule a domain action during an unavailable time slot.

AutomatedSnapshotStartHour.documentation: The time, in UTC format, when OpenSearch Service takes a daily automated snapshot of the specified domain. Default is 0 hours.

SnapshotOptions.documentation: The time, in UTC format, when OpenSearch Service takes a daily automated snapshot of the specified domain. Default is 0 hours.

Options.documentation: The daily snapshot options specified for the domain.

Status.documentation: The status of a daily automated snapshot.

SnapshotOptionsStatus.documentation: Container for information about a daily automated snapshot for an OpenSearch Service domain.

AutoSoftwareUpdateEnabled.documentation: Whether automatic service software updates are enabled for the domain.

SoftwareUpdateOptions.documentation: Options for configuring service software updates for a domain.

Options.documentation: The service software update options for a domain.

Status.documentation: The status of service software update options, including creation date and last updated date.

SoftwareUpdateOptionsStatus.documentation: The status of the service software options for a domain.

DomainName.documentation: The name of the domain.

StartDomainMaintenanceRequest.documentation: Container for the parameters to the StartDomainMaintenance operation.

StartDomainMaintenanceResponse.documentation: The result of a StartDomainMaintenance request that information about the requested action.

DomainName.documentation: The name of the domain that you want to update to the latest service software.

ScheduleAt.documentation:
When to start the service software update.

  • NOW - Immediately schedules the update to happen in the current hour if there's capacity available.

  • TIMESTAMP - Lets you specify a custom date and time to apply the update. If you specify this value, you must also provide a value for DesiredStartTime.

  • OFF_PEAK_WINDOW - Marks the update to be picked up during an upcoming off-peak window. There's no guarantee that the update will happen during the next immediate window. Depending on capacity, it might happen in subsequent days.

Default: NOW if you don't specify a value for DesiredStartTime, and TIMESTAMP if you do.

DesiredStartTime.documentation: The Epoch timestamp when you want the service software update to start. You only need to specify this parameter if you set ScheduleAt to TIMESTAMP.

StartServiceSoftwareUpdateRequest.documentation: Container for the request parameters to the StartServiceSoftwareUpdate operation.

ServiceSoftwareOptions.documentation: The current status of the OpenSearch Service software update.

StartServiceSoftwareUpdateResponse.documentation: Represents the output of a StartServiceSoftwareUpdate operation. Contains the status of the update.

StorageSubTypeName.documentation:
Sub-type of the given EBS storage type. List of available sub-storage options. The instance storage type has no storage sub-type. The ebs storage type has the following valid sub-types:

  • standard

  • gp2

  • gp3

  • io1

StorageTypeLimits.documentation: Limits that are applicable for the given storage type.

StorageType.documentation: A list of storage types for an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain that are available for a given intance type.

LimitName.documentation:
Name of storage limits that are applicable for the given storage type. If StorageType is ebs, the following options are available:

  • MinimumVolumeSize - Minimum volume size that is available for the given storage type. Can be empty if not applicable.

  • MaximumVolumeSize - Maximum volume size that is available for the given storage type. Can be empty if not applicable.

  • MaximumIops - Maximum amount of IOPS that is available for the given the storage type. Can be empty if not applicable.

  • MinimumIops - Minimum amount of IOPS that is available for the given the storage type. Can be empty if not applicable.

  • MaximumThroughput - Maximum amount of throughput that is available for the given the storage type. Can be empty if not applicable.

  • MinimumThroughput - Minimum amount of throughput that is available for the given the storage type. Can be empty if not applicable.

StorageTypeLimit.documentation: Limits that are applicable for the given Amazon OpenSearch Service storage type.

StorageTypeName.documentation:
The type of storage that the domain uses. Can be one of the following:

instance

Built-in storage available for the instance.

ebs

Elastic Block Storage (EBS) attached to the instance.

Key.documentation: The tag key. Tag keys must be unique for the domain to which they are attached.

Value.documentation: The value assigned to the corresponding tag key. Tag values can be null and don't have to be unique in a tag set. For example, you can have a key value pair in a tag set of project : Trinity and cost-center : Trinity

Tag.documentation: A tag (key-value pair) for an Amazon OpenSearch Service resource.

TagKey.documentation: A string between 1 to 128 characters that specifies the key for a tag. Tag keys must be unique for the domain to which they're attached.

TagList.documentation: A list of tags attached to a domain.

TagValue.documentation: A string between 0 to 256 characters that specifies the value for a tag. Tag values can be null and don't have to be unique in a tag set.

TimeUnit.documentation: The unit of a maintenance schedule duration. Valid value is HOUR.

id.documentation: The unique identifier for the OpenSearch application to be updated.

dataSources.documentation: The data sources to associate with the OpenSearch application.

appConfigs.documentation: The configuration settings to modify for the OpenSearch application.

id.documentation: The unique identifier of the updated OpenSearch application.

name.documentation: The name of the updated OpenSearch application.

dataSources.documentation: The data sources associated with the updated OpenSearch application.

iamIdentityCenterOptions.documentation: The IAM Identity Center configuration for the updated OpenSearch application.

appConfigs.documentation: The configuration settings for the updated OpenSearch application.

createdAt.documentation: The timestamp when the OpenSearch application was originally created.

lastUpdatedAt.documentation: The timestamp when the OpenSearch application was last updated.

DomainName.documentation: The name of the domain.

Name.documentation: The name of the data source to modify.

Description.documentation: A new description of the data source.

Status.documentation: The status of the data source update.

UpdateDataSourceRequest.documentation: Container for the parameters to the UpdateDataSource operation.

Message.documentation: A message associated with the updated data source.

DataSourceName.documentation: A unique, user-defined label to identify the data source within your OpenSearch Service environment.

DataSourceType.documentation: The supported Amazon Web Services service that you want to use as the source for direct queries in OpenSearch Service.

Description.documentation: An optional text field for providing additional context and details about the data source.

OpenSearchArns.documentation: A list of Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) for the OpenSearch collections that are associated with the direct query data source.

DataSourceArn.documentation: The unique, system-generated identifier that represents the data source.

DomainName.documentation: The name of the domain that you're updating.

ClusterConfig.documentation: Changes that you want to make to the cluster configuration, such as the instance type and number of EC2 instances.

EBSOptions.documentation: The type and size of the EBS volume to attach to instances in the domain.

SnapshotOptions.documentation: Option to set the time, in UTC format, for the daily automated snapshot. Default value is 0 hours.

VPCOptions.documentation: Options to specify the subnets and security groups for a VPC endpoint. For more information, see Launching your Amazon OpenSearch Service domains using a VPC.

CognitoOptions.documentation: Key-value pairs to configure Amazon Cognito authentication for OpenSearch Dashboards.

AdvancedOptions.documentation:
Key-value pairs to specify advanced configuration options. The following key-value pairs are supported:

  • "rest.action.multi.allow_explicit_index": "true" | "false" - Note the use of a string rather than a boolean. Specifies whether explicit references to indexes are allowed inside the body of HTTP requests. If you want to configure access policies for domain sub-resources, such as specific indexes and domain APIs, you must disable this property. Default is true.

  • "indices.fielddata.cache.size": "80" - Note the use of a string rather than a boolean. Specifies the percentage of heap space allocated to field data. Default is unbounded.

  • "indices.query.bool.max_clause_count": "1024" - Note the use of a string rather than a boolean. Specifies the maximum number of clauses allowed in a Lucene boolean query. Default is 1,024. Queries with more than the permitted number of clauses result in a TooManyClauses error.

For more information, see Advanced cluster parameters.

AccessPolicies.documentation: Identity and Access Management (IAM) access policy as a JSON-formatted string.

IPAddressType.documentation: Specify either dual stack or IPv4 as your IP address type. Dual stack allows you to share domain resources across IPv4 and IPv6 address types, and is the recommended option. If your IP address type is currently set to dual stack, you can't change it.

LogPublishingOptions.documentation: Options to publish OpenSearch logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.

EncryptionAtRestOptions.documentation: Encryption at rest options for the domain.

DomainEndpointOptions.documentation: Additional options for the domain endpoint, such as whether to require HTTPS for all traffic.

DryRun.documentation: This flag, when set to True, specifies whether the UpdateDomain request should return the results of a dry run analysis without actually applying the change. A dry run determines what type of deployment the update will cause.

DryRunMode.documentation:
The type of dry run to perform.

  • Basic only returns the type of deployment (blue/green or dynamic) that the update will cause.

  • Verbose runs an additional check to validate the changes you're making. For more information, see Validating a domain update.

SoftwareUpdateOptions.documentation: Service software update options for the domain.

AIMLOptions.documentation: Options for all machine learning features for the specified domain.

UpdateDomainConfigRequest.documentation: Container for the request parameters to the UpdateDomain operation.

DryRunResults.documentation: Results of the dry run performed in the update domain request.

DryRunProgressStatus.documentation: The status of the dry run being performed on the domain, if any.

UpdateDomainConfigResponse.documentation: The results of an UpdateDomain request. Contains the status of the domain being updated.

PackageSource.documentation: Amazon S3 bucket and key for the package.

CommitMessage.documentation: Commit message for the updated file, which is shown as part of GetPackageVersionHistoryResponse.

PackageConfiguration.documentation: The updated configuration details for a package.

UpdatePackageRequest.documentation: Container for request parameters to the UpdatePackage operation.

UpdatePackageResponse.documentation: Container for the response returned by the UpdatePackage operation.

PackageID.documentation: ID of the package whose scope is being updated.

Operation.documentation: The operation to perform on the package scope (e.g., add/remove/override users).

PackageUserList.documentation: List of users to be added or removed from the package scope.

PackageID.documentation: ID of the package whose scope was updated.

Operation.documentation: The operation that was performed on the package scope.

PackageUserList.documentation: List of users who have access to the package after the scope update.

DomainName.documentation: The name of the domain to reschedule an action for.

ActionID.documentation: The unique identifier of the action to reschedule. To retrieve this ID, send a ListScheduledActions request.

ActionType.documentation: The type of action to reschedule. Can be one of SERVICE_SOFTWARE_UPDATE, JVM_HEAP_SIZE_TUNING, or JVM_YOUNG_GEN_TUNING. To retrieve this value, send a ListScheduledActions request.

ScheduleAt.documentation:
When to schedule the action.

  • NOW - Immediately schedules the update to happen in the current hour if there's capacity available.

  • TIMESTAMP - Lets you specify a custom date and time to apply the update. If you specify this value, you must also provide a value for DesiredStartTime.

  • OFF_PEAK_WINDOW - Marks the action to be picked up during an upcoming off-peak window. There's no guarantee that the change will be implemented during the next immediate window. Depending on capacity, it might happen in subsequent days.

DesiredStartTime.documentation: The time to implement the change, in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). Only specify this parameter if you set ScheduleAt to TIMESTAMP.

VpcOptions.documentation: The security groups and/or subnets to add, remove, or modify.

DomainName.documentation: Name of the OpenSearch Service domain that you want to upgrade.

TargetVersion.documentation: OpenSearch or Elasticsearch version to which you want to upgrade, in the format Opensearch_X.Y or Elasticsearch_X.Y.

PerformCheckOnly.documentation: When true, indicates that an upgrade eligibility check needs to be performed. Does not actually perform the upgrade.

AdvancedOptions.documentation: Only supports the override_main_response_version parameter and not other advanced options. You can only include this option when upgrading to an OpenSearch version. Specifies whether the domain reports its version as 7.10 so that it continues to work with Elasticsearch OSS clients and plugins.

UpgradeDomainRequest.documentation: Container for the request parameters to the UpgradeDomain operation.

UpgradeId.documentation: The unique identifier of the domain upgrade.

DomainName.documentation: The name of the domain that was upgraded.

TargetVersion.documentation: OpenSearch or Elasticsearch version that the domain was upgraded to.

PerformCheckOnly.documentation: When true, indicates that an upgrade eligibility check was performed.

AdvancedOptions.documentation: The advanced options configuration for the domain.

ChangeProgressDetails.documentation: Container for information about a configuration change happening on a domain.

UpgradeDomainResponse.documentation: Container for the response returned by UpgradeDomain operation.

StartTimestamp.documentation: UTC timestamp at which the upgrade API call was made, in the format yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ.

UpgradeStatus.documentation:
The current status of the upgrade. The status can take one of the following values:

  • In Progress

  • Succeeded

  • Succeeded with Issues

  • Failed

StepsList.documentation: A list of each step performed as part of a specific upgrade or upgrade eligibility check.

UpgradeHistory.documentation: History of the last 10 upgrades and upgrade eligibility checks for an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain.

UpgradeStep.documentation:
One of three steps that an upgrade or upgrade eligibility check goes through:

  • PreUpgradeCheck

  • Snapshot

  • Upgrade

UpgradeStepStatus.documentation:
The current status of the upgrade. The status can take one of the following values:

  • In Progress

  • Succeeded

  • Succeeded with Issues

  • Failed

Issues.documentation: A list of strings containing detailed information about the errors encountered in a particular step.

ProgressPercent.documentation: The floating point value representing the progress percentage of a particular step.

UpgradeStepItem.documentation: Represents a single step of an upgrade or upgrade eligibility check workflow.

VPCId.documentation: The ID for your VPC. Amazon VPC generates this value when you create a VPC.

SubnetIds.documentation: A list of subnet IDs associated with the VPC endpoints for the domain.

AvailabilityZones.documentation: The list of Availability Zones associated with the VPC subnets.

SecurityGroupIds.documentation: The list of security group IDs associated with the VPC endpoints for the domain.

VPCDerivedInfo.documentation: Information about the subnets and security groups for an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain provisioned within a virtual private cloud (VPC). For more information, see Launching your Amazon OpenSearch Service domains using a VPC. This information only exists if the domain was created with VPCOptions.

Options.documentation: The VPC options for the specified domain.

Status.documentation: The status of the VPC options for the specified domain.

VPCDerivedInfoStatus.documentation: Status of the VPC options for a specified domain.

SubnetIds.documentation: A list of subnet IDs associated with the VPC endpoints for the domain. If your domain uses multiple Availability Zones, you need to provide two subnet IDs, one per zone. Otherwise, provide only one.

SecurityGroupIds.documentation: The list of security group IDs associated with the VPC endpoints for the domain. If you do not provide a security group ID, OpenSearch Service uses the default security group for the VPC.

VPCOptions.documentation: Options to specify the subnets and security groups for an Amazon OpenSearch Service VPC endpoint. For more information, see Launching your Amazon OpenSearch Service domains using a VPC.

ValidationException.documentation: An exception for accessing or deleting a resource that doesn't exist.

ValidationFailure.documentation: A validation failure that occurred as the result of a pre-update validation check (verbose dry run) on a domain.

Options.documentation: The OpenSearch or Elasticsearch version for the specified domain.

Status.documentation: The status of the version options for the specified domain.

VersionStatus.documentation: The status of the the OpenSearch or Elasticsearch version options for the specified Amazon OpenSearch Service domain.

VolumeType.documentation: The type of EBS volume that a domain uses. For more information, see Configuring EBS-based storage.

DomainArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the domain associated with the endpoint.

VpcOptions.documentation: Options to specify the subnets and security groups for an Amazon OpenSearch Service VPC endpoint.

Status.documentation: The current status of the endpoint.

Endpoint.documentation: The connection endpoint ID for connecting to the domain.

VpcEndpoint.documentation: The connection endpoint for connecting to an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain through a proxy.

VpcEndpointError.documentation: Error information when attempting to describe an Amazon OpenSearch Service-managed VPC endpoint.

DomainArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the domain associated with the endpoint.

Status.documentation: The current status of the endpoint.

VpcEndpointSummary.documentation: Summary information for an Amazon OpenSearch Service-managed VPC endpoint.

Hours.documentation: The start hour of the window in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), using 24-hour time. For example, 17 refers to 5:00 P.M. UTC.

Minutes.documentation: The start minute of the window, in UTC.

WindowStartTime.documentation: The desired start time for an off-peak maintenance window.

AvailabilityZoneCount.documentation: If you enabled multiple Availability Zones, this value is the number of zones that you want the domain to use. Valid values are 2 and 3. If your domain is provisioned within a VPC, this value be equal to number of subnets.

ZoneAwarenessConfig.documentation: The zone awareness configuration for an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain.

documentation: Use the Amazon OpenSearch Service configuration API to create, configure, and manage OpenSearch Service domains. The endpoint for configuration service requests is Region specific: es.region.amazonaws.com. For example, es.us-east-1.amazonaws.com. For a current list of supported Regions and endpoints, see Amazon Web Services service endpoints.
